Please translate it to english ? Please translate are you looking for something like this ? https://docsify.js.org/#/more-pages?id=more-pages I am sorry but I am not able to get your issue. Can you show some snippet with before/after comparing the use-case. oh I get it now. you want the homepage to be used as the fallback page right? --- In general : - We have `README.md` for fallback as for markdown based docs, readme.md works as the index. You can see the same in GitHub as well. So I wouldn't name my default or index points for a markdown based docs site to anything other than `README.md` The homepage is different than fallback of the root index page. But If something explicit ( like a config ) is mentioned like `fallbackHomepage : yourhome.md` then it would be more appropriate. As of now, it are not explicitly working on any new feature for v4. so I cant tell you now how much time it would take to support it. _perhaps you want to try itt out and create a PR if its ok_ Also I guess you can make some kind of workaround with [`alias`](https://docsify.js.org/#/configuration?id=alias) config Please translate to english There is already an issue open about this #740 You can try creating plugin for it Or even a script in navbar.md will work. You can take A look at #740 Closing this, if you have something else, please comment. I will take A look in it soon. Thanks for pointing this Please translate it to english and follow the template > it's better if you can translate the docs page of the website. Translating the readme might make the repo a bit messy. > > We do have translations on the website. Better keep it there itself. @Minhyeok-Oh lets leave the readme for now. Go for the site docs. Thanks for the PR 👍 > If changing the UI of default theme, please provide the before/after screenshot: Please submit the `before-after` screenshot of the change And also write the summary like the reason behind this and is there any issue it's fixing. Can you share the responsive of this change? Like in the mobile view. Its gonna look broken in some cases I guess. I am not 100% for this change. cc @felangel > @anikethsaha I will make it work in mobile view soon we need a discussion to have it or not. It goes against the concept of having a sidebar searching. Perhaps you can submit a proposal for having an opt-in configurable navbar searching system. Which will be placed in the navbar. Also, I need some PoC over this. We can add this for `v5` `v4` final release will just have bug fixes and minor changes that are required. https://github.com/docsifyjs/docsify/pull/951#issuecomment-557518739 We need a discussion about this. Please write it in english 👍 Good move 👍 agreed Please write it in english 👍 > The burger menu button must have discernible text You meant a tooltip ? > Search text input is also missing a :focus styling what style are you planning to add in the focus? Feel free to submit a PR We can take a look at the ratio thing Future. > For the burger menu an aria label should do the trick although the button seems a bit small. Can you try this and share the screenshot And about the input, try something which will work with other theme too. And I think the outer glow is bit more, try reducing it little bit I couldnt find it too left with the default theme. 1. With the current width `300px` 🔽 ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26347874/69337093-0d821000-0c86-11ea-9419-4d6c86df9208.png) 2. `sidebar width 500px` 🔽 ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26347874/69337040-edeae780-0c85-11ea-85e9-9b57d625c6d7.png) I can see the white gap in the `1` one but it aligns properly with the font-sizes and all. The second implementation is might be looking centered but it requires the font-size to be increased which is not match with the other font Perhaps you can show some PoCs > https://docsify.js.org/#/language-highlight is this what you are looking for? docsify uses [`marked`](https://github.com/markedjs/marked) for parsing markdowns and prismjs for syntax highlighting. I guess you can custom highlighter (https://marked.js.org/#/USING_ADVANCED.md#highlight) Can you please share your project structure 👍 . please look how docsify structured the docs https://github.com/docsifyjs/docsify/tree/develop/docs . You can access the readme docs from here itself https://docsify.js.org/#/ I am quite unclear about the request. Can you please give some use case and a bit explanation. > For e.g. - Test Link is 404 Would appreciate if you can create a PoC for the implementation 👍 Please add more explanation with use-cases for your feature request Also please use the issue template and dont remove the contents. Thanks 👍 @timaschew whats the process for releasing? @felangel any update on this release ? We need this for `master` and then release it I think its good to have it but as a configurable extension. I guess prism uses [line number plugin for this](https://prismjs.com/plugins/line-numbers/). We need to integrate it with docsify configuration as I dont think this is customizable with remark. Feel free to submit a PR for this or better create a docsify plugin for this. We need this for develop branch as well. Feel free to submit a PR 👍 **Summary** The existing emoji plugin is lacking support for lots of emojis. I have modified the emoji plugin to source emoji data from https://raw.githubusercontent.com/liguoqinjim/github_emoji/master/github_all/README.md instead. **What kind of change does this PR introduce?** (check at least one) - [ ] Bugfix - [ ] Feature - [ ] Code style update - [x] Refactor - [ ] Docs - [ ] Build-related changes - [ ] Other, please describe: If changing the UI of default theme, please provide the **before/after** screenshot: **Does this PR introduce a breaking change?** (check one) - [ ] Yes - [X] No If yes, please describe the impact and migration path for existing applications: **The PR fulfills these requirements:** - [x] When resolving a specific issue, it's referenced in the PR's title (e.g. `fix #xxx[,#xxx]`, where "xxx" is the issue number) You have tested in the following browsers: (Providing a detailed version will be better.) - [X] Chrome - [X] Firefox - [X] Safari - [X] Edge - [X] IE If adding a **new feature**, the PR's description includes: - [X] A convincing reason for adding this feature - [x] Related documents have been updated - [x] Related tests have been updated To avoid wasting your time, it's best to open a **feature request issue** first and wait for approval before working on it. **Other information:** --- * [x] DO NOT include files inside `lib` directory. @timaschew, @jthegedus can you take a look? @jingsam can you give an example of how you'd like me to structure it? `AllGithubEmoji` was just an array of emoji id strings and the way they were being resolved was directly via the emojis endpoint. The approach in the PR is to use the `unicode` endpoint and be able to just update the mapping of emoji id to image url. I'm not sure what you mean by just add the missing emojis since the whole data structure is different. **Update**: I initially tried adding missing emojis to `AllGithubEmoji` like `brazil` (for example) but they don't get resolved properly which is why I refactored the whole approach. @jingsam sounds good. I've updated the PR 👍 @timaschew i believe it aligns with #779 but I just added missing emoji names and left the lookup as is. It’s still using https://api.github.com/emojis to map the emoji name to the unicode url. 👍 There’s still additional work needed to automate this lookup. Edit: @timaschew thoughts? +1 for this I think we should wait for couple of days and we can merge this. cc @timaschew @jingsam / There are lot of unrelated changes which doesn't match with your PR title and description. **Create separate PR** for updating the prism and also create separately for those readmes and issue templates refactoring. Don't update and include a changelog with your PR, it will be automatically done when it's being released. Give proper commit messages so that it gives help in creating a better changelog. Closing this. Thanks 👍 We have it on our roadmap https://github.com/docsifyjs/docsify/pull/802 Please share a minimal reproduction repo for this. > clone the application I am not getting which application you are trying to run It's nice to have this feature like from each markdown file have some similar attribute like `relativeURL: self` or `relativePath:self`. the paths will be appended with `__dirname` to make itself relative. _thats what I am thinking_ But we are not sure if we can ship it soon or in `v4.x` as we are having quite a big number of bugs to fix. But it's considerable 👍 . I will put this in our discussion. I am pretty sure you can implement this using a custom plugin also. Creating plugins is quite simple, perhaps you can try creating this one 👍 ? Or if you want to submit a PR with this , go on 👍 > I like the idea of a plugin. I might just try that. If I do, I'll post a link to it here. Great 👍 ```js window.$docsify = { name: "REPO", repo: "https://github.com/some/repo", loadNavbar: true, coverpage: true, onlyCover: true }; ``` I guess you cant. And it makes sense if your docs site is only having the cover page, then having navbar doesn't do anything Closing this 👍 Please comment below if you think this didnt help you or you have something else to add 👍 Thanks for the PR 👍 Could you rebase? and I need to check if there is any breaking changes in this updating from `marked` side or not. and we will merge this soon 👍 here https://github.com/docsifyjs/docsify/pull/934/files#diff-b9cfc7f2cdf78a7f4b91a753d10865a2R45 But docsify is not released since then. Will do the release soon I guess we can close this 👍 > I wrote a plugin for this here https://github.com/TheGreenToaster/docsify-glossary. Closing this in favor of the above plugin. I guess that should work for your request. Please create a separate issue if this is not you were looking for and explain a bit extra for that. Is there any specific issue or link which might support this change? I need some reason to back these changes. I can see you checked `bugfix` box, need an issue link or any related links to back this Thanks @xmedeko actually the optimal flow is to have an issue and then discussing there we can decide whether its a bug or not and PR is required or not. Leave it for this one. No need to create an issue. We can discuss this here just for this PR. Also, can you provide some screenshots comparing `before-after` . ## PS `font-weight` for `strong` in default is `bold` which is `700`. Any specific reason you selected `600` ? https://github.com/docsifyjs/docsify/pull/913#discussion_r349230930 Actually thats where we are struggling a bit. The former maintainers I guess are not active and not maintaining so we are struggling to get the indentions of these few codes. Like this one. I am not sure why at first place these where `400` as these are not the `strong` styling (as you said too) I am actually +1 for this fix but not getting the motive of keeping it `400` at first place. I think we will go with this PR and if required we will revert this if it is suggested. I am down to `600` or `700`. can you please investigate if anything is breaking or looking weird with having `700` as that's the default by browsers > Since the doplhin and vue are using 600, I vote for 600 Ok let's go with `600`. > Hold on, I've been playing with that a bit and seems to me the 400 suites the headings and links better in this theme. Maybe separate strong style could be better. separate the strong from this group 👍 ohh shoot!! I forgot, can you please submit PR against the `master` branch > You should set the default branch to master from develop. We are discussing that. Actually `develop` is for v5 but there were quite a good number of bugs that needed to be fixed before v5 so we are working on final v4 release. So we need to have that discussing then we can change the default branch. So fast merging I would recommend submitting a new PR against master > Perhaps the search plugin should unencode the content? Not sure if there's any bad outcomes of doing that. I think there can be bad outcomes for this, this may lead to XSS if unencoding in the rendered dom. [refer this](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/33184716/is-it-safe-to-display-html-code-decoded-by-decodeuricomponent-from-a-url) Closing this for now. Please create a new issue if you think you can work it out safely or you have something more to share about it Thanks 👍 > Alright, I know why it happened!! The search index is being stored in Local Storage. When I make new pages, I copy one page, then rename it. If I save the page, before renaming it and changing the content, then the search feature indexes it and saves it in Local Storage (duplicate content). > > After changing the page content, the search index stays incorrect. > > I was able to clear the Local Storage in devtools, and refresh, and the problem went away. > > Seems like some care needs to be taken to ensure that the index does not contain content for non-existent pages. Thanks for the detailed explanation. Yes, its a bug. Feel free to submit the fix 👍 _perhaps for time being, we can add an instruction to the search plugin page about this issue_ it is supposed to be like that cause of the `id` parameter you queried in the header. try this https://docsify.js.org/#/configuration and scroll. Closing this as its intended behavior. Please open a new issue if you think this doesn't solve your issue thanks 👍 > Note, I disabled executeScript from executing my script a second time, due to #906. I noticed there that it attempts to catch the return value of the script. That's definitely not foolproof. executeScript should Be `true` in order to run your script that. These scripts are executed by docsify after the mounting of the HTML code. _(debatable 😕 )_ > window.__EXECUTE_RESULT__ = new Function(code)() that's an IIFE. It should run the code mentioned in the argument as a whole. ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26347874/69459204-41008f80-0d97-11ea-8d6b-518f128fef7f.png) From the image, you can see it's running the code, as usual, Not sure why the `beforeDestroy` is not working as I have not used Vue and just familiar with the outline. I think it's not related to the docsify code anyway. Closing this, please comment if you think it didnt help you with this explanation. or you something else to add upon 😃 > **What is current behavior** > > It executes the script twice! Did you face the execution of the script twice ? or its because of the code ? i I think this might help, _(though not 100% sure )_ `executeScript` to `true` mean that running script tag coming from markdown. this are not the one which you are writing in the HTML's header tag or which you are writing to HTML page by yourself. So as they are coming from markdown as a string and markdown are not parsing it, its skipping the rendering phase. So we need to manually run those code. So you can see [`here`](https://github.com/docsifyjs/docsify/blob/develop/src/core/render/index.js#L26-L28) it's running the inner js code. Its like if you want to execute some javascript code in the HTML , then you can write it in the markdown and then it will be executed. Its not executing script tags outside of the markdown. You can see the example here [`Markdown-script-code`](https://github.com/docsifyjs/docsify/blob/develop/docs/themes.md#click-to-preview) [Preview-of how it executed](https://docsify.js.org/#/themes?id=click-to-preview) ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26347874/69457842-f9c4cf80-0d93-11ea-9d2a-d4acf2e0511e.png) I hope this helps. Closing this. Please comment if its unclear or anything is wrong with it 👍 Unclear about the Request. Closing this. Do you have some concrete questions? Yes that was also my initial question. But then after I saw the page about [writing a plugin](https://docsify.js.org/#/write-a-plugin) I've realized that the `vm` is passed to the plugin function. I guess you would need to write in your markdown something like `{{author}}` and then in the beforeHook you can do something like ```javascript content.replace(/{{(.*)}}/g, function(match, group) { return vm.frontmatter[group] }) ``` But I think it makes sense to setup a convention for variables in general in docsify and provide to replace them by frontmatter attributes and implement it into the docsify core. see #758 We should add some test cases. I saw similar problems, for instance: https://github.com/docsifyjs/docsify/issues/717 I guess you rely on the class? I think the changes was an improvement (but also a breaking change). Because the checkbox were not disabled. The logic to parse this was removed from docsify because the marked parser can handle it now. The question is if it's worth tot add the code again in order to attach the class Instead of handle this as a breaking change. In future docsify should bump its major version for changes like this. @jhildenbiddle what do you think? Hi @jhildenbiddle alright I see the use case for it. I was actually expecting to achieve it much more simpler by using a selector like this: `.docsify-content li>input`. But that doesn't solve the problem to identify the parent `
    `. Replacing the input with a SVG sounds a bit overkill to me to be honest. Can't you style the input as well, like this [custom checkbox](https://codepen.io/arpitnj/pen/oCAqa/)? Anyway, I would suggest to fix the styling first and then we can discuss about the SVG in a dedicated pull request. Providing a `

When using both `loadSidebar:true` and `relativePath:true` relative paths in _sidebar.md files are resolved against the page being rendered rather than the location of the _sidebar.md file. This leads to surprising results. When one writes a relative path in a file, one expects it to be relative to that file, not some other file that implicitly includes it in some subdirectory. ***The work around*** is to only use absolute paths in _sidebar.md files since they may be rendered in arbitrarily nested subdirectories. The problem with this is that it makes it difficult to move an entire subdirectory that contains a _sidebar.md, and it requires authors to know and encode the full path to their subsite. I am in an environment where we pull documentation from multiple projects and integrate them into one website. I don't want authors to encode the full path to their project's documentation in the main site. This creates an unnecessary dependency, making it challenging to reorganize the structure of the combined site, and it also places additional burden on authors to know the path of their subsite. So I'm hoping that it's possible to resolve relative URLs in _sidebar.md files against the location of the _sidebar.md file. 🤞 #### Steps to reproduce ##### GIVEN ```bash $ tree . ├── README.md ├── _sidebar.md ├── index.html ├── subdir1 │   └── README.md └── subdir2 └── README.md 2 directories, 5 files $ cat _sidebar.md - [Home](README.md) - [Subdir1](subdir1/README.md) - [Subdir2](subdir2/README.md) $ cat index.html LibreFoodPantry

The search index is being stored in Local Storage. When I make new pages, I copy one page, then rename it. If I save the page, before renaming it and changing the content, then the search feature indexes it and saves it in Local Storage (duplicate content). After changing the page content, the search index stays incorrect. I was able to clear the Local Storage in devtools, and refresh, and the problem went away. The HTML rendered by [docsify-cli](https://github.com/docsifyjs/docsify-cli#readme) and listed in the [Manual Installation](https://docsify.js.org/#/quickstart?id=manual-initialization) section of the official docs results in the very latest version of docsify being loaded by default. This is not only bad practice generally speaking, but it also means that breaking changes introduced in a new major release could break *a lot* of live docsify sites. The suggested fix is to specify a major version number in all docsify URLs: ```html ``` This means that when a new *major* version is released, site admins will need to manually update the URLs with the new major version number (e.g. `@5`). The benefit of this approach is that breaking changes in the new release will not affect existing docsify sites since they are loading the previous version. If URLs are being updated, it's also worth considering the following: * Use CDN redirect URLs instead of specifying a path for the main lib file * Specify the URL scheme to avoid unnecessary redirects (i.e use `https://` instead of `//`) * Switch to jsDelivr (#756) for better CDN performance ```html ``` It's a valid issue for this repo since the [Manual Installation](https://docsify.js.org/#/quickstart?id=manual-initialization) section of the docs needs to be updated, but yes--work will also need to be done in the CLI repo. I've made a similar issue in the CLI repo. (Moving discussion of rendering unicode emoji from #768 to a separate thread) From #768: > According to [caniemoji.com](http://caniemoji.com), unicode emoji are supported all the way back to Windows 7, macOS 10.7, Android 4.4, and iOS 5. Switching to unicode emoji would remove emoji `` requests and render emoji native to each platform. Seems like a better route to go, so long as the unsupported OS+Browser combinations aren't a concern. [This article](https://about.gitlab.com/2018/05/30/journey-in-native-unicode-emoji/) will likely be helpful if/when the switch to unicode happens. My initial thought was to just leverage the [GitHub emoji API](https://api.github.com/emojis) to get both the alias and the unicode value: ```javascript // API { "+1": "https://github.githubassets.com/images/icons/emoji/unicode/1f44d.png?v8", ... "thumbsup": "https://github.githubassets.com/images/icons/emoji/unicode/1f44d.png?v8", ... } // Alias : "+1" or "thumbsup" // Unicode: "1f44d" // URL : "https://github.githubassets.com/images/icons/emoji/unicode/1f44d.png?v8" ``` GitHub has already done the work of mapping aliases to unicode values and images (the file name is the unicode value), as well as adding logical duplicates like the example above. As for the implementation: - Emoji data should be embedded in docsify.js, not requested from the GitHub API by the client. - GitHub data should be transformed to better fit docsify's usage and reduce client-side parsing. For example, instead of embedding GitHub's API data as-is: ```javascript { "+1": "https://github.githubassets.com/images/icons/emoji/unicode/1f44d.png?v8", ... } // const emojiURL = emoji["+1"]; // const emojiCode = emojiURL.slice(emojiURL.lastIndexOf('/') + 1, emojiURL.lastIndexOf('.')); ``` The data should be transformed to allow fast unicode and URL lookups: ```javascript { "+1": { unicode: "1f44d", url: "https://github.githubassets.com/images/icons/emoji/unicode/1f44d.png?v8" } ... } // const emojiURL = emoji["+1"].url // const emojiCode = emoji["+1"].unicode ``` - An automated task should be added that refreshes docsify's local copy of GitHub API data, transforms the data as described above, and stores the result in a file that docsify can import/require at build time. - A test for emoji support will determine if a unicode character or image is rendered. I'd likely reference [Modernizr's emoji test](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/Modernizr/Modernizr/master/feature-detects/emoji.js) and build from that. The test only needs to done one time, so the performance impact should be negligible. - Some minor CSS tweaks may be required for unicode emoji characters, and it will most likely make sense to wrap them in a `` tag with a unique class. These non-breaking changes will provide the following benefits: 1. Improved emoji rendering performance by removing image requests on platforms that support unicode emoji 1. Rendering of native emoji on platforms that support unicode emoji 1. Additional emoji alias support (docsify currently support 886, GitHub support 1508) 1. Simplified emoji support for docsify devs (via automated task described above) How does that sound? BTW, there are quite a few GitHub emoji lists generated from the GitHub API that we can direct users to: * https://github.com/ikatyang/emoji-cheat-sheet * https://github-emoji-list.herokuapp.com/ * https://jzeferino.github.io/AllGithubEmojis/ We should either reference once of these or provide our own auto-generated table in the official documentation.
